title: STEM Education Design Using 3D Virtual Worlds

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science and mathematics concepts, experience with VR devices
context.additional_context: Students collaborate in a multi-user virtual environment using personal devices (BYOD), performing scientific experiments and engineering design tasks.

learning_goals: Learners can simulate complex scientific phenomena and analyze experimental data in 3D virtual environments

Learners can analyze engineering design problems (e.g., sustainable bridge design) using virtual collaboration tools like Figma or Tinkercad, develop prototypes with 3D modeling or simulation functions within four weeks, and achieve over 70 points based on instructor evaluation criteria (functionality 30%, creativity 30%, collaboration efficiency 40%).
Learners are assessed on their ability to apply knowledge gained through VR-based learning activities to real-world cases
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
